name: Memoir '44 Online
description: Days of Wonder’s best-selling World War II board game is now available as a turn-based multiplayer online game on Steam!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7 Processor: Dual Core 1.6 GHz or better Memory: 1GB (XP), 2GB (Vista), 2GB (Windows 7) Hard Disk Space: 270 MB Video Card: OpenGL 1.4 or higher

reviews.review_text: Love the game. Own a copy myself. But I aint gonna pay money in order to get maps that I gotta pay for again. It's why I don't play that many free to play games in the first place. Money eaters.
really fun, really great game. not recommended only because you are basically paying a subscription to play it. not worth it for that.

This is a Pay-4-Play game with 50 free tokens, which amounts to a demo period. After the free tokens are gone, you are paying them or you are done. Oh, and if they say you lose connection before you even make your first move, those tokens you spent to play that map are gone. There is no such thing as owning this game. This is an arcade game where you need to keep pumping in the quarters to pay from now to eternity. At least Candy Crush lets you come back after a cooloff period if you don't want to pay for immediate continue.  So... play this decent game for 50 tokens. If you get addicted, start looking for the quarter slot on your computer. Or if you love it, go buy the board game and get reaquainted with your IRL friends. It'll be cheaper in the long run than entering your credit card number.  Would I play again? If I had been able to buy the game instead of rent it, sure I probably would. Would I pay from now to eternity to rent time on the game? Not on your life. Would I buy the table-top game IRL? Not after the sour taste in my mouth from losing my last 3 tokens trying to Storm Paris and having it say I disconnected.
Pay for literally every battle. Great but im not paying that .
I have the physical game, this is good digital replacement for when no one is around to battle. Board game is great also, highly recommended.

As much as I wish there was a 'So, So' rating to this, I had to chose negatively.] The game is really good on strategic levels, but the dice thing can be really unfair, and make it look like it favors your rival's side. Which can be really annoying. Also the 'Free to Play' thing can be REALLY deceiving for this. You have like, let's say credits in this game, which you NEED to play some maps. And when you run out, you're down to 2 very boring maps, so basically you need money to make this game interesting.   As I said before, the strategic level of the game is very good, but other features just decrease the ammount of fun you recieve playing this game. Just get the board game.
Command & Conquer X Chess placed in real life WW2 battlefield situations. Awesome.

I played this Steam version to determine whether or not I should get the board game, given all the praise surrounding it. Long story short, I am glad that this version was free because this game is just terrible. It's joyless, nonsensical, and void of any real decision making. It, like Twilight Struggle, is simply 'Here are your cards... base your strategy around them!' That is not fun by any stretch of the imagination.
